title: Nick Auterac
text:
Nick Auterac (born 12 November 1992 in <a href="Westminster">Westminster</a>, <a href="England">England</a>) is an English professional <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. He plays at <a href="prop%20%28rugby%20union%29">prop</a> for <a href="Northampton%20Saints">Northampton Saints</a>.
Auterac is a <a href="Saracens%20F.C.">Saracens</a> academy graduate. His lack of first team appearances at Saracens between 2011 and 2014 contributed to a 2014 move to <a href="Bath%20Rugby">Bath</a>. He was a regular starter in Bath's successful <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20English%20Premiership">2014–15 English Premiership</a> season. Bath reaching the league playoff final before being defeated by Auterac's former side Saracens. On 14 november 2018 it was revealed that Auterac had agreed terms with <a href="Harlequins%20F.C.">Harlequins</a>. Auterac went on to make his Quins debut against former club, Bath, in late October 2018. Playing in the <a href="Premiership%20Rugby%20Cup">Premiership Rugby Cup</a>.
On 21 January 2020, Auterac signs for Premiership rivals <a href="Northampton%20Saints">Northampton Saints</a> from the 2020-21 season.
International career.
In June 2021 Auterac was called up to the <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> squad for the Summer internationals.
